Class MapCell

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • HexComponent
            • MapCell
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable

    public class MapCell
extends HexComponent
    This class represents a hexagonal cell used to make up a Map object.

    Each cell has a type: No-flying, Initial, Customer, Free, OutOfStack, Tower, Thief, High_altitude, Initial_Processed, Inital_OutOfStack, Customer_Processed, or InStack. Each cell type is drawn in a different colour.

    Hexagonal cells know about their neighbors (if they are set using setNeighbor method).

    The neighbors of a cell are accessed by an index 0-5 inclusive.

    • The hexagons are pointed-top in orientation, the 0 index is the upper-right side
    • Indexes for the sides progress incrementally clockwise from the 0 index, to 5 on the upper-left side
    Eg.

    5 / \ 0

    4 | | 1

    3 \ / 2

    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • MapCell

        Create a hexagonal cell of the specified type

    • Method Detail

      • setNeighbour

        public void setNeighbour(MapCell neighbor,
                         int i)
                  throws InvalidNeighbourIndexException
        Set the neighbor for this cell using the neighbor index. The index for the neighbor indicates which side of the hexagon this new neighbor is on: 0-5 inclusive.
        Parameters:
        neighbor - The new cell neighbor
        i - The index specifying which side this neighbor is on (0-5 inclusive)
        Throws:
        InvalidNeighbourIndexException - When an index is specified that is not 0-5.

      • getNeighbour

        public MapCell getNeighbour(int i)
                     throws InvalidNeighbourIndexException
        Returns the neighbor for this cell using the neighbor index. The index for the neighbor indicates in which side of the hexagon the neighbor is: 0-5.
        Parameters:
        i - The index of the neighbor
        Returns:
        The cell that is on the i-th side of the current cell, or null if no neighbor
        Throws:
        InvalidNeighbourIndexException - When an index is specified that is not 0-5.

      • isTower

        public boolean isTower()
        This method checks if the current MapCell object contains a tower. This means that no adjacent MapCell object can be in the path to the destination
        Returns:
        true if cell has a tower, false otherwise.
